documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
sk your neighbor, “Why should I trust you?” 
What she is saying now still might be correct. Maybe spring is the right
time to prune roses. Moreover, if she gave an argument for her claim (such as
that pruned roses grow back more quickly in the spring, and it is better to
prune roses when they grow back more quickly), then that argument still
might be sound. Her current claim and argument do not depend on what she
said last fall. For this reason, it is normally a fallacy to reject people’s views
